thread.title: Tiffany Trump and First Lady Melania take life in the White House VERY literally for NYFW and Japan premier visit
thread.title_full: Tiffany Trump and First Lady Melania take life in the White House VERY literally for NYFW and Japan premier visit - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Tiffany Trump and First Lady Melania take life in the White House VERY literally for NYFW and Japan premier visit
text: Tiffany Trump and First Lady Melania take life in the White House VERY literally for NYFW and Japan premier visit Tiffany Trump wowed in white for her dad's inauguration, and her stepmum dazzled in white at the inaugural ball - and they were at it again today. Melania was all in white for a garden visit with the wife of the Japanese Prime Minister, after being criticised for missing their official tour of the White House yesterday. And Tiffany caught the eye at the Taoray Wang Fashion Week show Share By Ann Gripper 20:38, 11 FEB 2017 Tiffany Trump looked classy in a white kneelength dress and pink winter coat. (Photo: AFP) 1 of 10 Tiffany and her half-sister Ivanka both wore white for their dad's inauguration last month. (Photo: Getty) 2 of 10 Tiffany was at the show with her boyfriend Ross Mechanic and her mum Marla Maples, Trump's second wife. (Photo: Getty) 3 of 10 Tiffany took in the Taoray Wang show. (Photo: Getty) 4 of 10 Marla, 53, looked elegant in a grey cold-shoulder dress. (Photo: Getty) 5 of 10 Tiffany's stepmum Melania was on duty in Florida as she entertained the wife of the Japanese Prime Minister. (Photo: Splash News) 6 of 10 Melania and Akie Abe, right, toured the Morikami Museum and Japanese Gardens in Delray Beach, Florida with park administrator Bonnie White Lemay (Photo: REUTERS) 7 of 10 Melania had a matching white cardigan - although judging by the fan it wasn't because it was chilly (Photo: Splash News) 8 of 10 The First Lady kept a fan to hand in the sunshine (Photo: Splash News) 9 of 10 Melania fed Koi carp during the visit - and declared her love of gardening in a statement. She said: "Both our countries histories and cultures are steeped in the nurture and nature of gardening. "Having knowledge of different cultures and customs is a wonderful way to learn and to explore. Gardening teaches us the fundamentals in care and the evolution of living things, all while inspiring us to nurture our minds and to relax and strengthen our bodies." (Photo: Splash News) 10 of 10 More On Tiffany Trump Melania Trump
